"Evil Dead" (1981) was made for almost no budget. But it compensated by being campy and mocking the genre. The camera work was very good. The fast motion stuff showing the "demon" coming was what I think everyone remembers. The acting was really bad and funny. I was never sure if that was done on purpose or not, but either way it works well that way for the camp factor. Overall the movie is highly gory so much that you want to laugh non stop. At the same time it is creepy and even scary, especially the infamous tree rape scene. If you're not taking this movie too seriously, it is one of the first of its kind and so broke some taboos and you may find it is enjoyable.

Review title: It's like a B-Grade Movie that did it's homework.
Review_body: This is definately my favorite horror movie ever. It seemed to make the classic cliches seem brand new. I could watch this movie two times every day for a week and then not watch it for a month and then watch it again and it'll be brand f**king new. This movie just has something about it that makes it so great. I enjoy the continuity flaws seen throughout the movie and when I get some money I am going to go buy the special edition so I can listen to Sam and Bruce discuss this greatly flawed movie.

This movie was fantastic. I love how they pulled it off with such a low budget. After watching this I though wow I seen horror movies from the same era with three times the budget of this movie and the effects where worse then this. But that's what great about this movie. The monster effects in this movie are amazing for it's time. I found the monster effects breathe taking and the sounds effects where amazing. Sam Raimi's camera angles where great. The script was fantastic all in itself. Addition to the actors make this one of the best rising movies of all time. I would consider this to be the best low budget movies of all time.

Review title: best horror movie of all time
Review_body: I had seen evil dead-2 and I liked it very much soi bought a evil deadtrio movie DVD.I decidedto see part 1.It was darker and scarier than 2nd part.The reason I say its the best cosit was first movie for SamRaimi and Bruce Campbell and low budget came out with sucha pure,raw and good story line.The locationsthe movie was shot were also good. It shows u don't need to spend millions to makea good movie. It a mustwatch for any horror movie lover.

When Ash decides to take his girlfriend for a romantic night in a cabin he gets more than he bargained for. Coming across a book he doesn't know can bring the dead back, and a mysterious tape recorder, he is soon in lots of trouble, when he eventually goes crazy, and his girlfriend is less fortunate. This classic horror is one of a kind and impossible to remake without the original actors.Bruce Campbell keeps the action and comedy madness going all the way through this film. If you don't enjoy the Evil Dead your as mad as he is. Back when it was first released this was the original scary film, I was scared to watch this before I'd even seen it, now it is one of my favourite horror films ever, I even enjoyed the two sequels.

This film I saw 11 yrs ago and I watch it every year ever since. It is an incomparable trash horror movie. The plot is simple, but charm is unstinted. An old house somewhere in the dense forest infested with the malicious ancient spirits, that were waken from their eternal sleep by a group of teenagers that had come to the house to spend there some time making love and enjoying themselves. As all the spirits are wont to avenge their disturbed silence, that case wasn't an exception,  the manslaughter started taking place both in the house and outside it. Human beings paid for their intervention. It took almost an hour and a half for blood-thirsy ghosts to deprive themselves of intrusive people. During the film baths of blood are poured on the scene(the action mainly takes place in the house), main hero is just soaked to the skin with blood, some of his former friends are chopped into pieces etc. Trash horror classics, some moments are brilliant:struggle inside the house, Ash's possessed laughing  girlfriend; Campbell is just GROOVY.

The Evil Dead has to be one of the greatest horror films of all time. Its plot is not complicated, but straight to the point, the characters are few and interesting, and the pacing is wonderful. I had been a fan of horror for several years before seeing this movie. I read about it and wanted to see it, but at the time it was harder to find than uranium. I finally got to see it on the Sci-Fi Channel in the early-to-mid 90s, and I was spellbound. This movie scared the hell out of me and left me creeped out for a good while after it was over. After seeing this movie, my lifelong love of horror was cemented. If you are a horror fan and haven't seen this film, WATCH IT!!! And shame on you for not seeing it earlier.

I remember first watching this film as a ten year old kid, who had snuck a peek at his father's horror collection, and I ended up being absolutely terrified after seeing it, with it's utter scariness and blatant use of gore and decapitated limbs staying in my mind from years to come.Recently I bought the Necrominocon Edition of the Evil Dead Trilogy, and this film is still as scary and brilliant as the day I first saw it (the same can not be said about it's commercialised sequels Dead by Dawn & Army of Darkness though). One of the great things about ED is it's simple timeless tale of a group of friends going away for the weekend at a secluded and seemingly run-down cabin. The horror begins even before they get there, with a near fatal car crash, and a porch chair that seems to have a life of it's own. That's probably one of the great things about the ED, we are led to believe that all the trouble starts with Professor Knoby's reciting of text from the Necromonicon, but it's quite clear there is something evil in the woods, with Professor Knoby's recording only giving it the kickstart it needs to start Mayhem.One stand-out performance in this film is Betsy Baker, who plays "Linda" - the ill-fated girlfriend of Ash, who when possessed by the ED is turned into a giggling demon who chants hilariously "We're gonna get you, not another peep..". It is an absolutely brilliant and comedic portrayal, especially when you see Baker as Linda before she becomes possessed, in which she is a quiet and reserved. The horror and gore in this film isn't as gruesome as some of the stuff we see these days, but to put it in retrospect at it's time ED was rather controversial and was put in the same category as snuff-films by a lot of right-wing anti-movie violence and horror protesters. Though some might find the scenes with demons biting off their own arms, genitals being mutilated(the scene with Ash & the Scott-Demon) and a tree raping one of the females a bit too much to stomach.All in all, this is a classic horror film. Although it doesn't have state-of-the-art SFX, or high production quality of mainstream horror films made these days, it's all about the atmosphere of the film, the comedic scenes of a possessed Linda and Ash and his buckleys hope of making it out alive.

Overall good film, schlocky falls, trees violating women, and blood that appears and within seconds is cleaned up from the main characters face. The movie is slow to start out with and then when weird stuff starts happening, it is almost too much to keep up with! (Not really, you would have to be stupid to not keep up with this) There is just a lot of fodder to make fun of in this campy classic, definitely one for any viewer to experience to understand what true "Black Comedy" genre means. There are some good scares as the tension build up is on point, but with those scares comes equally amazing laughs which can not be beat. Check out my full review at HTTP://switchbladehorrorreviews.blogspot.com/

Review title: Students plus cabin multiplied by evil forces . . .
Review_body: A very bold movement for late 80's horror genre on Raimi's part. I thoroughly enjoyed this film as far as originality and gore go, but the story lacked a little strength. I found that after this film was released, an abundance of followers tried to match the rawness and ferocity of Raimi's picture but failed to achieve a level of belief. For a film with a small under used budget, unknown cast and a fresh director, this film achieved quite a lot in the "critically acclaimed" department. A cult classic that is full of unorthodox methods that managed to beat out Stanley Kubrick in 1983 for best video of the year, TAKE THAT "SHINING"!

OK!! I think The evil Dead is a real scary film, but also think they could use some less bloody effects, I really like the movie but the melting of the Zombies at the end was unnecessary. The makeup was splendid, and the house did play a true dark and lonely environment perfect for this kind of movie, y also think that voices of the demons calling for them are good.When I started to see the movie I never thought that it will became into that horrid nightmare, thats well too, when found more than you look for in a movie.And I must finally say that this is movie worth to see for every horror movie fan.

The new TV Show Ash Vs Evil Dead beginning, I though't that the minimum respect for this anthology of gore horror comedies was to begin by re-watching the hole trilogy and the 2013 sequel.Evil dead 1, the "scariest" of the trilogy, scary maybe due to Ash's persona (Bruce Campbell) not yet fully matured, or to the the comedy side not yet fully admitted, but great. Real early great gore low-budget effects, surprising and even sometime scary because of the graduating blood thirsty tension all through the movie. Great comic evil lines which will grow to become the evil dead trilogy signature. Even with my 21th century eye, I enjoyed the great work on decors and "antique" special effects. The precise, punchy and yet humorous touch of Sam Raimi makes it a masterpiece. My favorite scene: the mythological tree rape sequence!
This movie wasn't scary in the least. I was mostly laughing at parts that weren't meant to be funny. I was hoping at first, it was one of those so bad it's good movies but nope it's just bad.

Review title: This movie was disgusting....it just made me puke
Review_body: Right from when i was a kid, i have always love horror movies, i still love them so much. I have come across many people who just say its disgusting and evil and so on and so on...etc I have always liked good movies...especially movies that would scare the pants off me. Before watching Evil Dead, i was so happy that i was going to watch a good horror movie, but the movie angered so much...there is basically no story line.....nothing builds up, they are not trying to do anything, basically there is no point of the movie...the acting is bad...basically everything is bad, there are many scenes of unnecessary guts and gore....at one point of the movie, i asked my self.....where is this going? there are many things that are contradictory in this movie, i don't want to give spoilers,this should be a "Classic" but i must say i am disappointed. I would advice that no one pays hard cash for this movie, steal it, download it, borrow it....just don't buy it. This is not the worst movie made....but it was a serious disappointment to a Horror Fan

Review title: This movie made me wish I were dead
Review_body: The only thing that kept me alive was the need to leave this 1-star review.I can appreciate why this is a cult classic, and what they did given their budget is admirable, but the incessant violence and clamor get really tiring really quickly in a way that makes the plot, if you can call it that, forgettable. There was a scene that featured a spectacular usage of corn grits though. Overall, an ok party movie for thrills if you do not mind the headache you will have after watching.

Evil Dead is the ultimate experience in grueling terror this film is the 1980's great. One of the best damn horror films ever made. The premise is simple 5 people(college students) need A place to stay on vacation so they venture to a cabin deep in to the woods & listen to a book of the dead recording well not all as it seems & all hell breaks loose. It was inspired by Texas Chainsaw Massacre(1974). This film has very very very high replay value I bought on a blind buy unaware of what I was getting into this was in late 2001 it is a amazing horror if you have not seen this you are missing out check it out rent it, buy it watch it at a friends what ever you can do to see this just don't steal please! :) This film was almost remade also which it's good it was not. Anyways I hope this review is a help. thanks for reading!

Review title: The best in the horror movie genre (which doesn't say much)
Review_body: Out of most horror movies i have seen this one is the best, maybe second to the Exorcist.  I have not seen the sequels and don't know if they do this film any justice.  Although the dialog in the beginning is, well lets just say terrible, and if you over look the errors (in some scenes Ash is seen drenched in blood and the next frame there is none at all)it really is a very good film.  The plot is kind of creepy and the camera angles only increased the creepiness.  I also thought that the way you never really see what is causing the disturbance was very creative.  It a little bit predictable at parts but what do you expect for being made in the 70's(not released until 82 but it was made in 79) and for $50,000.  A great movie considering its budget and its time.

In Raimi's first movie you can already see his directing qualities. Conceived as a "This is cheap, but let's see how many people are going to throw up their lunch" film it features extrodinary camera work and a brilliant actor (Bruce Campbell) and Raimi did well in concentrating on them. Because of the bad script and the lousy co-actors, this appears indeed as a first try and in his second try (Evil Dead II) he adds what is missing in this film: humour. But with a few beers and friends it still is a sweet little movie, but nothing more (I give 6 out of 10).

Review title: You aren't a horror movie buff if you haven't seen this one!
Review_body: First, you have to appreciate the low budget that this film ran on, and go from there. I love the rubber-suits to the computer generated (yawn) junk that you find in the Army of Darkness. Great sound effects, and good old cinematography that new methods have been lacking in classic horror. It's almost as though you are going "insane" with Ash on his roller coaster of terror through the first two movies in this trilogy! I always wondered...when did this guy ever get some sleep!?!

Review title: What kind of movie has a shell like this?
Review_body: Wow. that movie was so bad it was almost worth it to watch to see how to not make a movie. I strongly suggest just about any other horror movie over it. The acting was terrible, and it was one of the most predictible movies i have ever seen. Nothing is really scary when you know whats going to happen before it does. And the problems havent even begun to start. I am well aware that a movie does not need great special effects to be a quality film, but when the special effects actually take away from the movie its another story. If you do decide to get it, make sure you look at the scenes when it shows the cabin and the moon in the background....i have never in my life seen such a poor editing job. Well i guess the movie is good for a laugh, cause thats all i did while watching it. If you could think of the typical unoriginal stereotype 70's B horror movie, this would be it. Watch at your own risk

Review title: Nowhere near as good as it is made out to be
Review_body: The Evil Dead is regarded as one of the great cult horror films made in the late 1970s and early 1980s. Made for approximately $300,000 as an expansion (of sorts) to a student film made by Raimi entitled "Within the Woods," this film relies (after the initial twenty minutes) entirely too much upon shock tactics and stage blood to propel events onward, although since this is sort of what Raimi and company intended to do, it's not really a fault of the film itself. In any event, the first twenty minutes or so are brilliantly shot, well-made, and hint at all sorts of subtle terrors awaiting the audience amidst the imminent buckets of blood. However, after the visceral evil begins, there is a sharp decline. A few scenes come across as remarkably tasteless, and I won't go into them here. However, one does not review solely based upon the negatives, and there are a few great moments within. As I have stated earlier, the beginning is brilliant. The camera work is spectacular (as it is throughout the film), and between that and the performances we are drawn into the events of the film. We are the college students, and we are there in this quietly sinister cabin in the woods. After the beginning, things turn a little too splatter with too little substance to sustain or warrant the blood-drenched "horrors." One shot from this film will stick with me for a long time, though: the camera looks down from the cabin's roof to see two characters talking between the shining headlights of an Oldsmobile. This is a powerful scene, at once shuddering with latent horror and revealing just how talented Raimi is at the surrealistic, subtle side of horror. Too bad he didn't reveal more of that here.

i watched this again recently and was amazed at how relatively timeless (ok, the special effects are just camp now) the movie was.  blair witch borrowed heavily from the outdoor shots, and i havent jumped so much in years at a horror film.

I love this movie. It has lots of blood and gore, chopping peoples body parts off, Awesome zombie people.  It has a little nudity which every horror movie should have.  They should put this movie back into theaters again. It is the best zombie movie. Its better than the living dead movies.

The movie was great. I saw Army of Darkness before this one and I have heard people say it sucked. But it was great. One of the best horror movies of all time. If you love blood and gore, then this movie is for you. If you haven't seen it yet, then go out and rent it or buy it.

Review title: This movie should be marked as the greatest horror movie. (Spoiler)
Review_body: (WARNING!: The following may spoil the movie.)I have just finished watching "The Evil Dead." this morning. Personally I think it is the best horror movie I've ever seen. And I've seen a lot of horror movies. (The Shining, The Exorcist, etc.) This movie is a classic horror story with tons of blood and death. There are two scenes from the movie that will stay in my mind. The first one is when one of the girls runs into the woods. She gets "lost" and is attacked by trees. I've seen several websites call this scene "The Tree Rape," but I have a correction on that. Do any trees really attack her, NO, vines do. The second part that will stay in my mind is when one of the girls is locked up, and the other is sleeping. A third girl is possessed and goes after the two boys. In the end of this attack she is dismembered and buried. The reason the is so gross is because it's realistic. During this she even gnaws off her own hand. Ultimately the quote from Stephen King is correct."This is the most ferociously original horror movie I have ever seen. And if you don't agree with that, watch every horror movie ever made, then watch this. I am positive this will be better.

Did they just grab these actors off the street because not one of them could act. This is one of those movies where you want the characters to die. Why is the girl barely rapping on the door and barely yelling help? Why did dude get attacked by the demon and the main character finally runs up from behind the demon and barely pushes it's shoulder and then is knocked into a piece of plywood he can't get off of him? Campy or not, this movie sucks!

This movie is among my personal "top 5 worst movies". I don't care how old the director was and how little money they had. It was a crappy movie with horrible acting, poor storyline and some of the worst neon-purple makeup I've seen in my life.The effects were all but scary, in fact I was either laughing or dozing off. If you ever want to see a fake moon over half the screen: go watch it. If you want to see $100,000 worth of artificial smoke, go watch it. If you don't care about lighting, go watch it. Seriously, the actors looked like deer in headlights every time they got a closeup.Thats about it. Don't waste your time.

I have to say I'm very surprised at all the negative reviews I've been reading. I'm an avid movie lover, frequenting the theaters at least twice a week if not more. Something about being able to just sit back in a dark room, with a big screen and great sound. It's just good fun. Movies are enjoyable, not all are realistic and I think that's the point. If I wanted something realistic, I would watch a documentary (which I do on many occasions).I think a lot of the reviews are being very unfair to this movie.

I was expecting more from this cult classic. Jaws is an example of a cheap film that uses the camera to achieve tension the budget can't. The Evil Dead seemed almost like a pornographic parody of some other film. Minus the sex of course.I found the camera angles erratic and distracting. The soundtrack could be described in the same way. The narrative was all over the place and the acting was on a par with Debbie Does Dallas. This film certainly doesn't stand the test of time in my books. This is to Sam Raimi what Bad Taste was to Peter Jackson. But if you love to see horror that's "so bad its good", this might be one for you. It certainly paves the way for its genre and has obviously inspired many films that followed but don't expect to be scared if true horror is what you're after.

This is a kick ass movie! The best way to watch it is to get a steak and a six pack. BBQ the steak, using plenty of "Bull's Eye" BBQ sauce, and make sure you've already started drinking the beer(this is a very important step). Once the steak is ready, start the movie and enjoy! Alternatives include as pizza instead of a steak and a mini keg(your roommates, if possible) for the six pack.JOIN US!Oh god, I need ten LINES!?!? alright then, here goes.........You should also buy the Evil Dead DVD that comes in the rubber book. The book seriously stinks, but it is awesome! Hours of fun decoding the secret text.The commentaries are really good too! Very entertaining!

Wow. This movie has number 1 spot on my shelf... Okay, so the effects are budget and tacky, the props are dodgy and break whenever Ash hits anything with them and the crew is visible almost everywhere, but this cult horror classic is truly awesome! What could be better than a guy hacking up zombies (whos hair and makeup changing in every shot), burning a book made from human skin and living to tell the tale? Well... The dodgy yet captivating effects of course!!! In my eyes this is truly Sam Raimis masterpiece, from the intricate detail of the changing box pattern to the tree which is very much alive, this phenomenon is one of the most horrifying movies i have ever seen. Who said we need computer effects to make a bloody great movie?

Review title: A Good And Scary Horror Flick
Review_body: This Is A Horror Flick From The 80's And A Awfully Creepy One At That. Basiclly,Four Friends(Or Five)Spend The Night At A Cabin In Tennesee. Then They Uncover A Old Tape Recorder Containing Readings From "The Necromongon" Or The Book Of The Dead.This Awakes A Evil Spirit That Eventually,Kills Off Most Of The Characters,Leaving One Character Named Ash Williams.He Is Killed At The End Of The Movie Although. Solid Scary Movie That Should Keep You Up For A Week.Rent Or Buy It.They Also Created Several Video Games Of The Movie,The First One Is On The Commodore 64.The Is A Sequel(Which Is More Of A Remake Than A True Sequel)And The Third One Wasn't Bad Either.

Review title: This film is just great!! lots of gore & a good plot.
Review_body: When i first saw this movie i was about 13 or 14 years old. At that point i found it very scary. but now that i saw it again a couple of years later i didn't find it so scary....i just thought that it was great...lots of gore and some scenes with great humor. The bottom line is.....it's a classic & you've got to see it!!

Two stars for the creative camerawork, and some impressive makeup considering it's time and low budget. At the time it was a creative storyline that became a terrible horror trope. Other than that, I watched this wanting to love it and ended up fighting with myself just to keep the damn thing on, and ended up being completely flabbergasted as to why it has such a strong reputation.The tree scene is ludicrous and unnecessary. This film relies too much on gore for both its scares and its humor but widely missed the mark on both. I love cheesy horror flicks, but there wasn't one second of this movie that I was either amused or scared, and I say that as someone who's a big fan of Romero's work. The acting is terrible and few movies have annoyed me as much as this one with its characterization of screeching and lolling "demonic forces." By the end of the movie I was half hoping they could come through the screen and kill me too for being stupid enough to watch this awful film all the way to the end.

Review title: Great horror movie don't take it too seriously
Review_body: Evil Dead was made in 1979 by a bunch of students out of Michigan on a shoestring budget, drive and a lot of guts. They froze, ate crap, got beat up and cut and burned themselves out.The end result, after $350,000 and 3 years of post production was an awesome, gorefest, filled with silliness, great scares and eye-popping scenes.It starts off slowly enough with the teens going up for a weekend of supposed getting' it on and after reading a forbidden book tapped on a tape recorder, well, all hell breaks loose. The lone pretty girl is lured into the woods and raped by malevolent trees (awesome scene!), she comes back and begins to butcher her friends. They begin one by one to turn into monsters and attack the lone survivor who uncovers the only way to defeat the evil in the woods...or did he? Anyway, 10 on 10, hat's off to Raimi and his crew and may this never be remade. It's perfect the way it is.

Review title: A gruesome, irresistable tale that will have you wretching, laughing, crying (well, not quite) and clawing for more!!!
Review_body: After reading about this film online for the longest time and how good it supposedly was, I had to run out and finally rent it one night.  Holy poop, was I blown away!! Bruce Campbell, Betsy Baker, 'Sarah York,' 'Hal Delrich' & Ellen Sandwess pull off an extraordinary film, and for many of their acting debuts.  Under the writing and direction of Sam Raimi, this film is a masterpiece with experimental angles and shots, stop-animation, fast shots, sudden close ups, great mood and even some crude, but very effective, clay-animation.  All these features send this group of friends into a whirlwind as they drive along that infamous road, leading to that eerie cabin in the woods.  Only one will leave (or will he/she) alive, the question is who and how?  Not only does this film 'do it' for its fans visually, but the originality is extremely odd and bizarre, but very scary and totally applicable to the plot.  From possessions, dismemberments,***SPOILER*** an unforgettable tree-rape scene, (yes you read that correctly) to a slight love story and some heartfelt emotions, this film has it all and should be on the shelves of all die hard horror fans - or any movie fan in general. Oh, by the way, DEFINITELY NOT for the slight of stomach.  This film begins pleasantly with friends on the road to a 'nice vacation spot' and then leads to the insane happenings at the cabin in the woods that will change all of their lives.  At the cabin, the archaeologist who lives there off and on, is not at home and all that the group finds of him is a tape recording and a book.  The book of the dead.  The Necronomicon.  With this book and the tape recording, this group of friends will unleash the evil that lurks in the woods around them and ultimately pay the price for their naivete. Well, all I have left to say is go out and SEE IT ALREADY!!! :) This film kicks major bootay!

Review title: Lovable but obviously the worst in the series
Review_body: When I first saw this movie, I was alone and in my room at midnight, with a storm brewing outside. That is how everyone should experience this movie. While it doesn't follow the rest of the series it is very likable. It does spook you at some times, but you need to watch the series in order, otherwise you wont get what you want out of it: comedy and a chainsaw. Scary, but everytime you're spooked you'll soon shake your head thinking "Damn, I should of seen that coming." A pretty good movie all on its own, but I prefer Evil Dead 2 ten to one. Rent it.

Review title: One of the worst movies I've seen!
Review_body:
Directed and written by Sam Raimi, The Evil Dead is the movie to see if you want to be unimpressed. With the leading man, Ashley, played by Bruce Campbell, bringing his friends Linda, Cheryl, Shelly, and Scott, played by Betsy Baker, Ellen Sandweiss, Teresa Tilly, and Richard DeManincor, to an abandoned cabin in the woods. These young adults are caught in the middle of a demonic takeover and it would have not been more cliche.
First, the acting in this film is anything but good. Starting in the very beginning, one of the characters is being squished against a car window, however the lack of real expression and resolve from that is so funny. One minute these people would be in such a great fear and then next they would just be sitting there as if nothing had happened. I understand that this movie is a horror flick and is not actually realistic, especially with the action from the woods, but that does not mean the actors should be unrealistic as well. Having what is going on in real life would obviously scare anyone to death, yet the characters just don't react as quickly or as strongly as they should. The only okay part of the acting came from Bruce Campbell and that came finally to the end.
The steps that each character took in this film were highly predictable from the beginning. As well as seeming to speed up the plot. With every turn there was something happening, they did not give the characters time to reflect on the moment. It felt like falling down a hill and not being able to stop. By forcing the characters to have to do the unfortunate thing makes the movie boring with the constant knowing of their decisions and consequences.
The setting is okay, very basic but okay. It just seemed like a cheesy low budget haunted house put on by teenagers. Being that this is quite a low budget movie, I understand the lack of specialties. However, there are several unnecessary things they could have cut and went a different route to save money and improve the movie. For example, the use of clay-mation was at a total loss and denied the possibility for a fear factor in this film. Yes, mixing elements can help improve a movie, but the director should have taken a better look before putting a random spot of clay-mation in the final cut.
That money could have possibly been used for better makeup because that was hideous to look at, in a bad way. Looking like a 10 year old painting their face for Halloween, this makeup ruined another possible moment for this movie to shine. The cheap prosthetics and overuse of blood to try to cover up the bad reality of this awful movie really looked like they were struggling.
This movie may be "iconic", but in my eyes the only thing iconic about it is how horribly they missed the mark for a good movie. Instead of being scary this movie was more of a drab comedy at best. Just because this movie is low budget does not give the director an excuse to not meet the requirements of a good movie. Look at The Blair Witch Project, an incredibly done movie on such a low budget. I am glad that in 2017 they redid the movie and attempted to save the movie that Raimi messed up so much. My rating on this movie is a D-, barely passing because it is well-known, but I believe it is well-known for the wrong reasons.

The Evil Dead is an amazing film. Many people like to call it the greatest horror film. I wouldn't take it that far, but it does compete.The movie is about five friends go to an old cabin and unleash an evil force within the woods and everything goes on from then on. I will not spoil the movie for you.The movie is insanely gory, perhaps one of the goriest movies ever. But its also fun. If your looking for a fun scary night, this is the movie for you. The movie has some funny moments and it is also really scary, so if you have some friends over and want to pop a movie into the television, this is the movie you should put in. It is a must-see for any horror movie fan. ~Ferolocaust

Review title: One of the best of it's kind.
Review_body: Excellent low-budget horror. The other movies in the series have progressively more comedy in them, which is fine, but this one still has the power to scare you. For my money this is the movie that 'Blair Witch' learned the most from.

Review title: The Best Horror Movie of all time
Review_body: The first horror film i've seen. and it's simply the best horror film ever made. a masterpiece in his genre. The beginning of a cult director and actor, Sam raimi and Bruce Campbell.

What can i say about this amazing movie? Pretty much everything about it is good, the over the top gore, the excellent camera angels, the claustrophobic setting, it's all good. Granted, it is dated, and some of this seems cheesy to the point of laughing, but buy the end of the movie, all i could say was "wow".  About half way through the movie, it all of the sudden becomes very weird and surreal (I think it starts when a pipe filled with blood bursts.  This movie isnt necessarily meant to be taken seriously, but it's not really a comedy.  This movie was meant to be the ultimate experience in grueling terror, made by a bunch of three stooges fans.  If you are a fan of horror movies, or someone that loves movies a lot, this is a must see.

Review title: A beautiful but evil kind of splatter
Review_body: This movie is the most intense horror movie ever made. Not granting you one chance to take some breath. This is a must see for all people who believe that Scream is the most scary movie ever. I like Evil Dead II more ... but this one really ... rocks the splatter ...

The summit work of horror cinema in my opinion. An example of imagination , persistence and love to the art. The first film of Sam Raimi still remains the best (I haven't seen SPIDER-MAN. In Spain not released yet).OK I admit the film isn't for everyone, but is the perfect one for me and for everyone who loves that genre. I said love. Those who like the last examples of american teenager horror or simply interested in women (for my friends the women can make them go to see a movie... The horror genre is one of the "sexual" genres, I think, but now they abuse too much...) can try...The plot of The Evil Dead isn't special, but it has something that makes it special. Could be the camera movements, the remember of a movie that really scared me (today no one can... not because I'm not the young boy that I was, it's because it was and remains scary), the gore, the low budget but effective fx, the genial Bruce Campbell, the pencil in the foot, those white eyes, or simply that cabin in the dark woods, so cosy, so scary, so dark, the kind of place where everyone want to go with his/her boy/girlfriend and friends to be one night and subconsciously want to get scared.
10 out of 10.

I thought this movie was great. Better than the second, not sure about Army of Darkness. I love the trilogy. The first time a saw it, i didn't like it. But the second time it was awesome. Would definetly recommend.

Review title: Don't believe the hype,- could've been brilliant, but isn't.
Review_body: I love horror films, but finding a good scary horror film is not something that occurs very often. Then I hear about the Evil Dead,- a film for which I haven't seen a bad review so I thought I would pay out some of my hard earned money for a copy on VHS. Were my expectations too high? Maybe. In the opening scenes, the acting is wafer thin, the script not too good either. Then the scene with the cellar was genuinely creepy,- if the rest of the film was left to the imagination like this scene then I think maybe we would have a timeless classic on our hands. Very tense. Some of the special effects are still impressive (even 20 years on), but the make up is just hillarious. It isn't scary, it just seems like a joke. The reactions from the cast when they encounter the "undead" is so annoyingly bad,- imagine one of your best friends/your girlfriend has been possessed by an ancient evil spirit, i'm sure you'd look just a little bit concerned/frightened/confused. Not just "lets kill it" without an element of "what the hell is going on?!"Maybe I'm being harsh, as apparently the film was made with a reasonably small budget,(which would perhaps forgive the amazingly non-frightening make up), but how hard is it to look frightened or to look surprised? This film could've been brilliant, but it is two dimensional with a poor script with mediocre acting - and this comes from somebody who loves horror movies. That aside, if you've had a few beers and you are with your mates this film would definitely be a good laugh. The disappointing this about that is it isn't intended to be a comedy. Don't get me wrong, this isn't a terrible film, just not as good as it is made out to be,- don't believe the hype. Watch it without expecting much then you will probably enjoy it. 6 out of 10 for effort.

I´ve saw this film years ago (1987) and it´s scared the hell of me...Saw it tonight, and now I´m wondering how the hell I´m gonna sleep...The only film that I can´t watch without press pause like 10 times, to have a chance to catch my breath....with all this said, I´ve truly wonder how anybody can think this is also a comedy...some say that the Exorcist is the most scariest movie of all time.I say it´s THE EVIL DEAD...like I said...be aware...Defenetly not a comedy !

Review title: Not just a cult classic, made its own genre
Review_body: I watched it last week for the umpteenth time. Evil Dead (and Evil Dead 2) is a film I never tire of. As a filmmaker very few films inspire (particularly a horror film) you to really pursue your dreams. This film did that for me way back when and I am eternally grateful. Made on a shoestring, it's right up there with Blood Simple in terms of making it possible for a "poor" filmmaker to aspire to greatness. And, it's obviously not just a cheese-ball low budget-indie horror flick, it's one of the most ingenious hilarious, yet scary flicks to this day. Sam Rami has obviously gone on to bigger (and perhaps better) things since Evil Dead, but without it there would be no Spider Man, or A Simple Plan for his career. A great flick that really doesn't date.

Review title: One of the best horror films ever!
Review_body: This is really a good movie! You just get everything you need in here. You get romance, evil trees, demons, blood and the list just goes on.You just have to love this movie, but that is only if you not are the kind of person who only love action-scenes and special effects, cause this movie is really low-budget.I would dare to say that The Evil Dead series is the series that in my eyes have been mixing comedy and horror in the best way.Go watch the movies, and also check out the musical! Funniest thing i've seen in a long time.If you are into horror movies watch it, if you aren't, still watch it and the maybe you will be into horror in the future :)

Review title: A fanfare of laughs, gore and more laughs
Review_body:
The Evil Dead caused a lot of controversy when it was released in the UK. It was banned by the BBFC and was put on the list of obscene videos by the Director of Public Prosecutions.

This only increased it's popularity with the viewing public. The Evil Dead tips it's hat to a lot of earlier genre movies, and also has a lot of influence from other genres, notably the Three Stooges.

Whilst the production values are not up to Hollywood standards, there is no denying that the Evil Dead did prove a point. It was made on a low budget, it was made by people who had only ever made Super 8 movies. It wasn't intended to be a blockbuster at the Box Office.

Yet it gave a lot of cinema-goers thrills, chills, scares and gore. The soundtrack is very fitting, and just adds to the charm.

The Evil Dead is a classic. It will stand the test of time as a low budget, shocking yet funny horror film.

Sam Raimi surpasses any horror director with his masterful, low-budget slasher flicks. I am not saying that these movies are awful. No, they're wonderful. A mix of horror and comedy is what cult movie fans are looking for.  Look for Bruce Campbell's witty comments through out the movie.

if u want to be REALLY SCARED then view this movie .....it is about a number of friends who went to a cabin and found the book of the dead....it is really the type of horror that makes u scared but not disguted. A last piece of advice that i want to say is ...never view this movie alone!!

Review title: Scariest, terrifying, stomach-churning cult horror movie!
Review_body: I call it Tension Raiser No. 1. I saw it on a local video hall in my neighborhood. That time I was a sixth standard student. I must say I got scared out of my pants. Could not go out at night time outside for a long time. Sometimes I was jolted out of my sleep by dreams of the possessed girls of the film choking my throat with their dreadful hands. How would one define a good horror film? A good horror film evokes terrible and relentless tension and unease. Despite knowing that its merely a movie, one gets scared terribly and the terrible hangover lingers for much longer time than one is comfortable with. Evil Dead is one such one of a kind film. The most memorable scene? The fast moving camera chasing the actors, of course. Thanks Sam for giving us such a gem to cherish on. The best horror cult movie ever.

Fortunately Sam Raimi more than makes up for this with his next installment. I suppose if you like pure gore, you'll like this film.  For those who like their horror to actually be entertaining, either through plot, special effects or cheesy one liners, you'd do better to skip this one and see the second.  Or just see Nighmare on Elm Street instead. ***SPOILERS AHEAD*** First of all, Ash was a wuss.  He does actually get as far as chaining his zombie girlfriend to the table before wimping out, but I missed the Ash that wouldn't think twice about chainsawing a zombie to pieces. The tree rape scene... what the hell?  We're in a movie with zombies, and this girl gets raped by TREES?!  The one girl gets possessed by being stabbed with a pencil, the other just has the evil rushing toward her and she screams.  So don't tell me it "shows how the evil enters her body." The other people were possessed much more quickly and without the disturbing hentai scene.  Completely unnecessary. ***END SPOILER*** If you're going to make a bad movie, at least make it funny.  Skip this one and watch ED II, or better yet, Army of Darkness.

7,6 ?? Really ? I'm still amazed I actually made it to the end of the movie without throwing my TV out the window! This was beyond crap. Unbelievable. I mean, I have seen my share of bad horror movies, but this one is right up there with the worst of them. Val Kilmer in the Traveler is Oscar material in comparison, that's how bad this is. What do you do when your best friend that suddenly turned into a zombie attacks you and drives a pencil through your ankle? You do the only reasonable thing anyone would do, take a nap of course.Suddenly they just turn into zombies? And what's the deal with the man in the background when they drive over the bridge? Oh well, another 80 minutes of my life I'll never get back.To summarize: I give this movie 1/10.
Its sad you don't see these type of movies anymore ,but this by far the most sickining movie of all time ,i grew up watchin this type every halloween month, creeps me out everytime

The Evil Dead is just a REALLY scary movie. Low-budget, the plot is simple and direct, the characters are few, but the pacing is wonderful.I had been a fan of horror for several years before seeing this movie. I read about it and wanted to see it, but at the time it was harder to find than uranium. I finally got to see it on the Sci-Fi Channel in the early-to-mid 90s, and I was spellbound. This movie scared the hell out of me and left me creeped out for a good while after it was over. After seeing this movie, my lifelong love of horror was cemented. If you are a horror fan and haven't seen this film, WATCH IT!!! And shame on you for not seeing it earlier.

'The Evil Dead' was one of those films that no-one ever got to see as there was little call for it in Video, but now with DVD it is readily available for anyone. And thank god for that! People can have opinions of this film which weren't derived from some friend who probably hadn't seen any of the trilogy, never mind the first. The film may have been banned when it was first released, but it is not the scariest film ever made and apart from Big Boy Bruce the acting is not the greatest. But the tension is excellent and the directing from Sam Raimi is effective as well as impressive, especially when you consider that this was his debut feature film. The possessed characters are brilliant, better than the make up in Romero's Trilogy, and the back drop is used to perfection.It may be another in a long line of horrors in the wood, but it easily stands out as one of the best due to its scares brought out through the high quality cinematography and Sam Raimi himself. And the underlying humour that is apparent throughout just improves it further (see the present Ash gives to his girlfriend).

This is an excellent film in every way possible! It has the low-budget feel to it with a top-budget atmosphere. It starts with a group of teenagers staying at a cabin when they start to turn into zombie/ demon things. The graphic violence is really in your face and makes sure you see exactly what is happening. The gore in this film is very well done and convinced me that I prefer This kind of FX over CGI. The use of stop motion/fake body parts just adds to the overall creepiness of it. The camera shots are very nice and are noticeable for being so creative. Everything about this film was phenomenal except a couple of points (nitpicking):I HATE jump scares(this film has some) The reason as to why they turn into demons/zombies is never explained and the book/tape recording is never fully explained (Doesn't really need to be anyway since it's a horror film) The sound is mostly either dead silent or knock-you-out-of-your-seat- loud. It took me a while of thinking to actually come up with a couple of points of things I didn't like about it; now that's when you know this is a good movie. This movie helps define what horror movies are all about.

**Spoilers**DON'T READ THE FOLLOWING REVIEW WITHOUT SEEING THE MOVIE FIRSTThe Evil Dead, on rottentomatoes.com, was raved as a wonderful movie. After renting this crap, all I can say is, if it was supposed to be a horror...it sucked, if it was supposed to be a comedy...it sucked. The movie is incredibly lame, comedy or horror, I may have laughed but even if the attempts were to make it more of a comedy, I thought...well that it was dumb to try to also make it a horror...just pick a genre!! Also, even if it was intended for laughs, the movie is incredibly disgusting...a tree rapes a girl??? That's GROSS! The special effects and visuals and makeup aren't "imaginable" like some may claim...they are just cheap and gross. This movie was a waste of time!!Grade: F

Review title: One of the most influential horror films of all time.
Review_body: This movie is one of the most influential pieces of cinematic horror ever. Sure it's a cheeseball of a film (To those of you that complain about it... What do you expect? That it would be some great academy award winner? A handful of college kids with virtually no budget made this movie. And I believe they did a fantastic job... I wouldn't even know where to begin.)The Evil Dead perhaps has the most HUGE cult following ever... behind Rocky Horror Picture Show.Plus... The way the whole movie is filmed is excellent... The camera angles and the sound alone are really mind blowing. That's good ole Sam Raimi. Let's hope he'll kick out an Evil Dead IV for us to put the series to bed properly.

If you are looking for a horror movie that scares you, leaves you with images 'till next morning, and even then causes you to wake at nights even years after watching, this is the movie for you. It is definitely disturbing, dark, hopeless, creepy, and everything a good horror movie is. That being said, it is a B-horror movie with a budget of less than 400,000 dollars. So the special effects are just good enough and the actors just convincing enough to sell it. The movie dances on today's line of ridiculously thrilling or hilarious with it's claymation. However, the story is original, thrilling, and sticks with you. Don't watch with the kids or grandparents.

Review title: Grueling, Mr. King? Oh, how clean the thrust.
Review_body: No matter the cheap effects, much less the college acting, I had to have a deep tissue massage once the final credit of this film had completed its upscreenward journey. If there is one thing I'll give this film, it is that it keeps you in suspense. Sam Raimi's use of sound and angle are merely the infancy of his genius. I dare say the second was even more grueling. Hats off to you Mr. Raimi, we know now what got you that Spiderman bid.In Evil Dead, we also had a glimpse of Bruce Campbell's early acting. He plays the naive oaf with uncanny perfection as Ash, the unsuspecting hero of this film. Of course, in subsequent sequels, Evil Dead II and Army of Darkness, the character of Ash develops from this same unsuspecting hero and naive oaf to a crazed lunatic in the second film and finds himself a war hardened veteran of deadite war in the third.The ladies of Evil Dead are captivating in spite of the dingy cinematography and 80's acting style, and they look none the worse for the wear what with the cold Tennessee atmosphere and tea saucer contact lenses. They certainly do make that old cabin and Hal Delrich's garage look mighty frightening. Oh, and hey, Ted Raimi's in this one.

The original, and maybe the best. Just watched it, borrowed from friend, whilst home alone. Unbelievable. A textbook horror, perfectly formed, excellently timed suspense, great make-up, brilliant pacing. I loved it. A horror masterpiece! **minor spoilers** I loved the way Ash, at the start, stands with an axe in the corner, whilst Scotty says - "hit her! hit her with the axe!" and he just stands there like, "shiiiiiiiiit!" and does nothing - totally different from the ash we all came to know and love. It rally is a Greuling experience - I feel drained. I think the best thing about it was the way that it could get away with so many clichés (creaking doors, thunder and lightening, spooky lighting, and the cabin in the woods scenario itself) - because this is it! This is the original, the trail blazer - it defined a sub-genre - survival horror (okay okay, there was Alien, but that's sci-fi) - and I loved every minute. Watch, see, feel sick, reel, close your eyes in digust = all of these are the Evil Dead Experience.10/10

I live in Morristown, TN. This movie is awesome!!! Maybe I can fill some of you in on a few things..One of the local backers of this film was assistant producer Gary Holt. He and his family own a location called Renaissance Farm. It was a horse training farm. A Big red barn in the far western part of Hamblen County, Morristown, TN. Later on it was a flea market, for awhile. Now it is some other business. Note at the starting of the movie, on the screen, Renaissance Pictures. The local locations of the film are in Morristown and surrounding areas. At the first of the movie, when the yellow Oldsmobile is traveling down the gravel road, and met head on with the red truck, notice the concrete bridge in the background.. that bridge is non other than Old Highway 25 E in Grainger county. The Highway, 25E is now being widened into a 4 lane highway, they have been working on this road project for years and still are today. It is right on the border of Claiborne County, near Tazewell, TN. The dirt and gravel road sits directly on the other side of the Clinch River.... To access this gravel road, go straight across the bridge, take a right turn and go under the bridge and that will take you right down on the gravel road and on down to the river... Also, filmed in Grainger county, the scene directly after this one.... Where the car horn is being blown and you see the 2 men walking (fisherman I think). Look directly in the background and you will see the opening that was cut into Clinch Mountain for the HWY 25E widening project back in the middle to late 1970's. That part of the mountain is visible in 2 scenes. The road that the 2 men are walking on is the OLD HIGHWAY that was a 2 lane, winding road. As this movie was filmed a long time ago..... the trees have all grown up in that area now and you cannot see the top of the mountain from that area anymore. That road they are walking appears to be at the starting of what is left of the old road that runs near the Poor Valley area. If you are going to go north on HWY 25E from Bean Station and Morristown and upon the mountain, that road will be the first road on the left as you are starting to go up the mountain. The actual cabin where the movie was filmed is (was) located in west Hamblen County, Morristown, TN in the same general area as Panther Creek State Park area...just a bit of the way up from the park.....I have never been to the house....but I have heard about it.....It is not visible from any road. It sit (s) far back up in the woods. Some people make the mistake and get it mixed up with another old "haunted house", The Murrell Melville Home, that is in the area and sits near the road... THE EVIL DEAD CABIN DOES NOT, DID NOT SIT NEAR ANY ROAD. The entrance is in an unmarked driveway that enters a field. The cabin sat way back in the backcountry almost in the woods. This is plainly visible in the film. I will not give directions to the cabin or cabin site... they are posted on other Evil Dead websites, they are not 100% accurate though. Anyway, the reason I know all of the above information is that I am a lifetime resident of Morristown, TN and I remember this film being made. Mr. Holt is well known in this area. Anyway, that is my 2 cents worth.... I hope you enjoyed reading it....EVIL DEAD LOVER

What can I say? EVIL DEAD was a horror masterpiece. First of all the story is brilliant,long dead demon ghosts possess college kids in a creepy forest, you can tell it's going to be good.But even better the director keeps you interested by using strange camera angles and using so many twists you cant even begin to expect the most cliché scenes in films.The makeup was, for the most part believable,and the cast was great ,especially Bruce ,using facial expressions and making the scene believable,and the eeriness of the movie gets you straight from the beginning. All in all if you like horror, WATCH THIS MOVIE!\best movie ever

Review title: Horrible film, yet all the more entertaining
Review_body: If you are truly looking for a cheesy, horribly made film, then there is no better then The Evil Dead. First of all, you will laugh at the horrible film making. There are goofs and mistakes galore. Crew members visible in the bushes, disappearing blood, costume changes, etc., it is all here. Ed Woods Plan 9 from Outer Space does a better job at covering up its mistakes. The plot, one of the only good points in this film, besides the laughable bad acting, is very interesting and it is good for the sequel (one of my favorite movies) Army of Darkness. The only other good thing about this film is that it spawned the career of cult actor Bruce Cambell. But the very best seen is a rape sequence in which a girl is raped by... trees. Yes, trees. it still reminds me of the trees in the Wizard of Oz. "These ain't your apples!". So if you have had a rough day and just want to simply turn your brain off, pick up Evil Dead. if you are looking for a great old horror classic, pick up army of darkness. because evil dead is merely a five year old's rendition of army of darkness.

I watched "The Evil Dead" this evening in the Halloween spirit and was fully disappointed. I had looked forward to watching this movie in our living room, nicely decorated for Halloween. This is actually one of the worst, most boring, most predictive movies I have ever had the displeasure to watch. I suffered through the entire movie but my wife only lasted 6 minutes before she went to bed to read a book. Thank goodness I did not invite a guest over to share the experience. I just can't believe anyone sober would give this movie any more than a 2/10 rating. Don't waste any valuable time watching this horrible "horror' movie...I wish I had gone to bed and read a Shakespeare play or a text on Quantum physics.

Review title: Ash is a hell of a character!
Review_body: There were some things in the movie that would not disturb a real horror movie fan -like me. But for the majority of people, i think that its slasher effects like the death of the characters, are a little bit disturbing, only just a little bit. The make up is bold and the fog and smoke effects look fake. But, but, but, but... Don't get me wrong. It's an 80s movie. An 80s horror classic. You don't expect the perfect effects and graphics. It's all about the story and the perfect characters and perfect acting! Ash is a hell of a character. He has a great style. he is both sensitive and courageous. He also cares about his friends and only about saving himself. He is bold and straight,full of hope and ready to fight. He is a kind of a hero. These characteristics of Ash are those who make this movie a horror classic. I have not yet seen the new film but I think that if they kept the same format as this movie, it will be great! Looking forward to see Evil Dead II and Army of Darkness...7/10 from me. I am a little hard on this one...

Not sure why this movie gets so much praise. The acting is god aweful, makeup and prosthetics are horrific, plot makes no sense, and it's just annoying even for an early 80s movie. It doesn't even compare to the other classic horror films in a anyway.

There was this one part where they tried to pass off grits as some sort of gross bodily fluid, but I was like nah thems just some tasty grits. Would recommend.Did you know, grits are just mashed corn. I didn't believe it when I heard it. My sister told me and my dad. We didn't believe her so we beat her so bad she has to use leg braces now. It turned out she was right all along. We laugh about it every time she falls down because the joints in her braces aren't oiled enough and stiff up.

I've always enjoyed The Evil Dead however, recently I've really found myself enjoying it. It is a very inspiring movie to me; Raimi and everyone else involved really pulled something amazing together with almost nothing. Listening to the commentaries and reading into the behind the scenes of the movie really shows that they put everything they had into the movie. People were injured and got sick but kept working on this labor of love.

Review title: The Best Horror Movie Ever Made!
Review_body: Well, except for Evil Dead II and Army of Darkness. Seriously, if you have never seen this movie, do so! It has influenced many other horror films. One can watch and rewatch this movie and see something new each time. The special effects were revolutionary for its time. This movie sets the standard for modern horror. Bruce Campbell truly made his mark in this one. Also, you can't go wrong buying the Evil Dead trilogy. Once you see all three movies, you will probably be hooked for life. As far as something current related to the trilogy, please go buy 'My Name Is Bruce' when it is released for DVD. Supporting indie horror keeps this genre alive and well.http://www.evildeadnews.com/

The movie is scary as well something nit all horror films have.it has some flaws like the perfomance of the protaginsts isnt good all of the time and the charachters tend to do stupid things a lot. It has a lot of raw violce and gore scenes. I also like how the film develops.it does so in a fast but steady way, it builds tension and atmposphere(i love the idea that 5 students crash at a remote Mountain cabin with eerie atmosphere)

Evil Dead is the greatest cabin/horror films of all time. I worship the fact it was shot on film, at that time with no contacts and no budget. Well, I've read of how they sold their idea to dentists and lawyers to get small chunks of money, but shooting on film is so expensive! How can any filmmaker/video maker not respect Sam Raimi in that time for accomplishing what he did in 1983?! I have been making short videos/music videos since 1994. I have always had the taste of horror/gore, but was never ambitious enough to go full on and make a feature. Any movies i have made have been shot on video, and have been no longer than 40 minutes. Its too damn expensive to do a feature ... or so i thought until seeing Evil Dead again last week. Now, with a fresh perception in 2006, i hope to start my latest idea as a feature, and push it in festivals. Thanks Sam!!!

Review title: Do not watch alone or in the dark.
Review_body: This movie was on satellite, and I recorded it on the DVR. So, one night after my sister and nephew and niece went to sleep I decided to watch it. I didn't know what I was in for. The movie starts out a little slow and a little generic, but it gets terrifying when they find the cellar. I could hardly breathe! I sat on the couch trying to take my mind somewhere else, but realized that this would ruin the movie, so I buckled down and enjoyed the ride. I'm 20 and weigh 280 pounds, and several times I shrieked out loud. I love horror movies, and The Evil Dead zoomed straight up to the top of my list. I was a little disappointed in the ending, because it wasn't very original. I think it was trying to be like Night of the Living Dead where no one survives, but done a little poorly. The part where the demoninhabited people melting was a little goofy but still disturbing. All in all this movie is horrifying and bloody, but it really works.

Personally, I love low-budget horror movies, and my friends told me that I should watch Evil Dead because of this. This is not a horror movie. This is a gross-out movie. There's no plot, acting is subpar, and the only thing that would make you watch it is if you have a blood fetish. OVERUSE OF BLOOD IS NOT A SUBSTITUTE FOR PLOT, CHARACTER, OR ANYTHING ELSE
